title: Introduction to Machine Learning and Applications
description:
This module provides students with a broad understanding
of the concepts, limitations, and applications of machine
learning. Students will be exposed to the fundamental
concepts of machine learning, including supervised
learning (regression and classification), clustering, and
methods such as SVM, neural networks, decision trees,
and ensemble methods. Pitfalls and limitations such as
overfitting, data leakage, bias, and ethical issues will be
covered. This module also emphasizes on the
applications of machine learning to problems in different
domains (such as medicine, finance, engineering, science,
business, social science) and is suitable for noncomputing students.
prerequisite:
(CS1010 or its equivalent) and (MA1101R or MA1311 or MA1508E or MA1513) and 
(MA1102R or MA1505 or MA1507 or (MA1511 and MA1512) or MA1521) and 
(EE2012/A or MA2216 or ST2131 or ST2334)
preclusion: BT4240, CS3244, DMX1401AI or its equivalents
